committee.name: Cybersecurity, Infrastructure Protection, and Security Technologies Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Protection.

Referred to the Committee on House Administration, and in addition to the Committees on Homeland Security, Intelligence (Permanent Select), the Judiciary, and Foreign Affairs, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 29 (Wednesday, February 14, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. THOMPSON of Mississippi:H.R. 5011.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:The United States Constitution Article 1, Section 8, Clause18, that Congress shall have the power to make all laws whichshall be necessary and proper.[Page H1178]

item.title: To protect elections for public office by providing financial support and enhanced security for the infrastructure used to carry out such elections, and for other purposes.

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
